subject: Philosophy
title: Preferred Indifferents
description: A short lesson to help you apply Preferred Indifferents.

hook.text: If health isn't truly 'good,' does a Stoic ignore a broken leg? Of course not.

buildup.text: The Stoics created a clever middle category: preferred indifferents.

discovery.text: Health, wealth, and pleasure are preferred but not necessary for a good life. They're bonuses, not goals.

twist.text: This lets Stoics pursue comfort without being enslaved by it. Lose your wealth? Your virtue remains.

climax.text: The trick is wanting things without needing them. Enjoy good fortune; don't depend on it.

quiz.question: What are 'preferred indifferents' in Stoicism?
options: Things worth pursuing but not necessary for virtue
